<a href="style=%22border-bottom:none!important;%22" target="_blank"></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>As a single newsletter, Valentine’s Day week is always a little tough. We haven’t yet found the Evening to our Morning, the outbox to our inbox, the subject line that pierces the heart. But through the ups and downs, we still have our very first love—making business news fun.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which is why we created Merger Week, the Brew’s celebration of corporate tie-ups. This week we’ll be exploring mergers through the lens of human relationships—from how companies meet (yes, there are merger dating apps) to why others break up and avoid each other at the grocery store. We hope you enjoy learning about mergers and always welcome your feedback. </p>
</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/09/facebook-faces-irs-irish-tax-crackdown?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Zuckerbergs Wake
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Photo of Mark Zuckerberg looking concerned" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxMjY0NDIwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alex Wong / Getty</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Imagine filing your taxes online, pressing submit, and seeing that you owe $9 billion. That’s the bill Facebook is facing when it takes on the IRS in a made-for-Hollywood tax case beginning this week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Maybe that’s a stretch, but the <a href="https://www.propublica.org/article/whos-afraid-of-the-irs-not-facebook?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nine-year odyssey</a> has been great theater:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>When former Google exec Sheryl Sandberg joined Facebook in 2008 to guide a 23-year-old Mark Zuckerberg, she reportedly </span><span><a href="https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/6648480-Facebook-Ireland-Emails-1.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">steered him</a></span><span> in one particular direction: Dublin, Ireland. Many U.S. tech companies have established operations in Ireland for the friendly tax rate and proper Guinness pours.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>To rev the profit engine in Ireland, Facebook created an Irish subsidiary that licensed tech from the U.S. parent company. Yes, two parts of the same company are technically </span><span><em>allowed</em></span><span> to do business with each other but only at a fair price for the assets. The IRS alleges that the Irish Facebook paid the American Facebook less than it should have because it wanted to avoid paying 35% in taxes—then the U.S. corporate tax rate. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The IRS calculated that Facebook </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-and-irs-prepare-for-9-billion-u-s-tax-court-fight-11581177600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">owes it about $9 billion</a></span><span>, roughly equal to FB's global tax bill in 2018 and 2019 combined. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What Facebook argues</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s tried to paint a portrait of the company as young and risky. Facebook had “no mobile advertising revenue, its international business was nascent, and its digital advertising products were unproven,” a spokeswoman said. The low value represented the uncertainty of the company’s future.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What the IRS argues</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2010, Facebook’s trajectory was up and to the right and the assets were worth at least double what Facebook calculated. It also says it has evidence (internal emails) that shows execs set up the Irish operation mainly to take advantage of the tax benefits. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Despite being gutted by budget cuts, the IRS is mounting a last-gasp charge to rein in the many U.S. corporations sprinkling profits around the world. We’ll have to wait months to find out whether it’s successful.  </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F09%2Ffacebook-faces-irs-irish-tax-crackdown" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/09/highlights-2020-academy-awards?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Party at Bong's House
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Bong Joon ho said he is ready to drink after winning many awards " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=362 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/KDVsZlSaVeUSVu1SnY/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Bong Joon ho said he is ready to drink after winning many awards " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/KDVsZlSaVeUSVu1SnY/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p class="Text-sc-1amvtpj-0-p render-stellar-contentstyles__Paragraph-sc-9v7nwy-2 fAchMW" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Somewhere in LA right now, Bong Joon Ho is demolishing cheesy bread from Domino's. The director's film, <em>Parasite</em>, became the <a href="https://www.cnn.com/entertainment/live-news/oscars-2020/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first non-English film</a> to win best picture at the Academy Awards last night. And he became the first South Korean to win a best director Oscar. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><span>Renée Zellweger won best actress for <em>Judy </em>and Joaquin Phoenix won best actor for <em>Joker</em></span></span><span><span><em>.</em></span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Other highlights:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Chris Rock ribbed attendee Jeff Bezos: “Jeff Bezos is so rich, he got divorced and he’s still the richest man in the world. He saw </span><span><em>Marriage Story</em></span><span> and thought it was a comedy.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Netflix’s </span><span><em>American Factory </em></span><span>won best documentary. The film, produced by the Obamas’ Higher Ground Productions, tells the story of a shuttered GM factory in Ohio that was revived by a Chinese billionaire. We </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/20/american-factory-explores-dynamics-globalization-midwest?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote about it in August</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F09%2Fhighlights-2020-academy-awards" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/09/british-airways-747-sets-record-new-york-london-subsonic-flight?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Ginger Ale Hits Different at 800 mph
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A chart showing the transatlantic crossing of BA flight 112" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTY4L2FfY2hhcnRfc2hvd2luZ190aGVfdHJhbnNhdGxhbnRpY19jcm9zc2luZ19vZl9iYV9mbGlnaHRfMTEyLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Flightradar24</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Saturday night, a British Airways 747 set a new record for the fastest subsonic flight between NYC and London. We’d say the travelers were lucky, but they didn’t even have time to digest their “dinner” before flight attendants started handing out “breakfast.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details:</strong> BA112 got <a href="https://onemileatatime.com/transatlantic-flight-speed-record/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">from NYC to London</a> in 4 hours and 56 minutes—1 hour and 38 minutes ahead of its scheduled arrival and 17 minutes faster than the previous record-holder, a <span>Norwegian jet in 2018</span>. The plane reached a maximum speed of 825 mph on its 3,450-mile journey.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wondering how that happened? </strong>It’s not magic, but it’s close: a jet stream provided by Ciara. The <a href="https://apnews.com/bdcc7cd1cd0b4c041a13793f65fc431c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">winter storm</a> blasted Europe with up to 93 mph winds, forcing cancellations of flights and the Manchester City-West Ham Premier League match. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here:</strong> More transatlantic travel knowledge bombs:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>NYC-London isn't the fastest transatlantic flight at all. For example, an Aer Lingus plane flew from Boston to Dublin in 4 hours and 49 minutes the same night.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It's important to note "subsonic" when talking about the record. In 1996, the supersonic Concorde plane flew from NYC to London in two hours, 52 minutes, and 59 seconds. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOSPITALITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/09/financial-times-reports-habitas-raises-20-million?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Will Habitas Get an Uber Discount Now?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A picture of a hotel from the Habitas website " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTgzL2FfcGljdHVyZV9vZl9hX2hvdGVsX2Zyb21fdGhlX2hhYml0YXNfd2Vic2l0ZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Habitas</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Uber cofounder Travis Kalanick has <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/aa668820-49cf-11ea-aeb3-955839e06441?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">joined a cabal of worldly investors</a> backing <strong style="color:#000">Habitas</strong>, a hotel startup trying to create “Club Med for Millennials," the FT reports.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What Habitas does:</strong> occupy the sweet spot between “Prague hostel” and “mom and dad used all of their points.” The Habitas concept (inspired by a camp at Burning Man) peddles rooms for $200–$400/night and prioritizes the social aspects of traveling, like food and music.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it doesn’t:</strong> take its time. Habitas 3D-prints the basic structures of its hotel rooms, which limits buildout time to six to nine months and earns Habitas a return on investment within two years—unheard of for traditional hotels, cofounder <span>Oliver Ripley told the FT.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Habitas will use its fresh $20 million to expand to new markets in Asia, the Middle East, and Africa.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Habitas <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/angelinavillaclarke/2018/07/18/how-the-habitas-brand-is-changing-the-way-we-travel/?utm_source=morning_brew#5e76e3fc1525?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">says it’s capitalizing</a> on the trend du jour for millennials—human connection over fancy lobbies—in a strategy made famous by clubs like Soho House and The Wing. But like them, it also knows no one’s ever said “nah I’m good” to rooms straight out of Architectural Digest.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/09/week-ahead-february-10?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

The Week Ahead

<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Loooove is in the air. And so are thorny questions of monetary policy, inflation, and corporate earnings. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday: </strong>President Trump releases fiscal 2021 budget; earnings (Allergan, Loews, Restaurant Brands International)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>Fed Chair Jerome Powell testifies before Congress; New Hampshire primary; Samsung's Unpacked event; earnings (Under Armour, Hilton, Hasbro, Lyft)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Powell testifies before Congress again; earnings (SoftBank, Cisco Systems, Teva, Molson Coors, TripAdvisor)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>CPI inflation data; World Radio Day; earnings (PepsiCo, Kraft Heinz, Nvidia, Expedia, Roku, Wyndham Hotels, Yeti, Nestlé, Nissan, Barclays, Alibaba, Airbus)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Retail sales; new Bieber album; Valentine’s Day; NBA All-Star Weekend begins</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MERGER WEEK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Why Companies Merge
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Merger Week banner picture " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxMjk2MzY5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ian McKinnon</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unlike humans, companies aren’t social creatures. They enjoy living alone, prefer not to share food, and avoid snuggling at all costs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But global merger and acquisition activity <a href="https://www.axios.com/2019-global-merger-acquisition-activity-9fd0f946-267c-42a4-adc5-48744a77c542.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit $3.9 trillion</a> last year. So clearly there are forces outside of biology bringing firms together. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On the first day of Merger Week, the Brew's Neal Freyman will walk you through those forces driving some of the biggest deals in history (Exxon + Mobil) and some of the most nonexistent deals in history (FanDuel and DraftKings). <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/09/not-cuz-like-companies-merge?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Give it a read here</a>. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BEYOND CROSSWORD: MERGER WEEK SPECIAL EDITION
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top:20px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGood morning. \u003c/strong\u003eAs a single newsletter, Valentine’s Day week is always a little tough. We haven’t yet found the Evening to our Morning, the outbox to our inbox, the subject line that pierces the heart. But through the ups and downs, we still have our very first love—making business news fun.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhich is why we created Merger Week, the Brew’s celebration of corporate tie-ups. This week we’ll be exploring mergers through the lens of human relationships—from how companies meet (yes, there are merger dating apps) to why others break up and avoid each other at the grocery store. mso-padding-alt: 0px 15px 15px 5px;\"\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCrypto: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBitcoin \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-09/bitcoin-breaches-10-000-to-reach-highest-level-since-october?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopped $10,000\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for the first time since October. It’s up about 40% this year.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eD.C.: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump will release a (largely symbolic) \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-to-propose-4-8-trillion-budget-with-big-safety-net-cuts-11581274525?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$4.8 trillion budget\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e today that increases military spending while cutting funding for safety net programs, reports the WSJ. The budget pegs economic growth at 3% in 2021. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTECH\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/09/facebook-faces-irs-irish-tax-crackdown?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nZuckerbergs Wake\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Photo of Mark Zuckerberg looking concerned\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxMjY0NDIwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eAlex Wong / Getty\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eImagine filing your taxes online, pressing submit, and seeing that you owe $9 billion. That’s the bill Facebook is facing when it takes on the IRS in a made-for-Hollywood tax case beginning this week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMaybe that’s a stretch, but the \u003ca href=\"https://www.propublica.org/article/whos-afraid-of-the-irs-not-facebook?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enine-year odyssey\u003c/a\u003e has been great theater:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhen former Google exec Sheryl Sandberg joined Facebook in 2008 to guide a 23-year-old Mark Zuckerberg, she reportedly \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/6648480-Facebook-Ireland-Emails-1.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esteered him\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in one particular direction: Dublin, Ireland. Many U.S. tech companies have established operations in Ireland for the friendly tax rate and proper Guinness pours.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTo rev the profit engine in Ireland, Facebook created an Irish subsidiary that licensed tech from the U.S. parent company. Yes, two parts of the same company are technically \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eallowed\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to do business with each other but only at a fair price for the assets. The IRS alleges that the Irish Facebook paid the American Facebook less than it should have because it wanted to avoid paying 35% in taxes—then the U.S. corporate tax rate. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe IRS calculated that Facebook \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-and-irs-prepare-for-9-billion-u-s-tax-court-fight-11581177600?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eowes it about $9 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, roughly equal to FB's global tax bill in 2018 and 2019 combined. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat Facebook argues\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s tried to paint a portrait of the company as young and risky. Facebook had “no mobile advertising revenue, its international business was nascent, and its digital advertising products were unproven,” a spokeswoman said. The low value represented the uncertainty of the company’s future.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat the IRS argues\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2010, Facebook’s trajectory was up and to the right and the assets were worth at least double what Facebook calculated. It also says it has evidence (internal emails) that shows execs set up the Irish operation mainly to take advantage of the tax benefits. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eDespite being gutted by budget cuts, the IRS is mounting a last-gasp charge to rein in the many U.S. corporations sprinkling profits around the world. We’ll have to wait months to find out whether it’s successful.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" render-stellar-contentstyles__Paragraph-sc-9v7nwy-2 fAchMW\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSomewhere in LA right now, Bong Joon Ho is demolishing cheesy bread from Domino's. The director's film, \u003cem\u003eParasite\u003c/em\u003e, became the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/entertainment/live-news/oscars-2020/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst non-English film\u003c/a\u003e to win best picture at the Academy Awards last night. And he became the first South Korean to win a best director Oscar. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRenée Zellweger won best actress for \u003cem\u003eJudy \u003c/em\u003eand Joaquin Phoenix won best actor for \u003cem\u003eJoker\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOther highlights:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eChris Rock ribbed attendee Jeff Bezos: “Jeff Bezos is so rich, he got divorced and he’s still the richest man in the world. He saw \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eMarriage Story\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and thought it was a comedy.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNetflix’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eAmerican Factory \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ewon best documentary. The film, produced by the Obamas’ Higher Ground Productions, tells the story of a shuttered GM factory in Ohio that was revived by a Chinese billionaire. We \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/20/american-factory-explores-dynamics-globalization-midwest?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote about it in width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSaturday night, a British Airways 747 set a new record for the fastest subsonic flight between NYC and London. We’d say the travelers were lucky, but they didn’t even have time to digest their “dinner” before flight attendants started handing out “breakfast.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details:\u003c/strong\u003e BA112 got \u003ca href=\"https://onemileatatime.com/transatlantic-flight-speed-record/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efrom NYC to London\u003c/a\u003e in 4 hours and 56 minutes—1 hour and 38 minutes ahead of its scheduled arrival and 17 minutes faster than the previous record-holder, a \u003cspan\u003eNorwegian jet in 2018\u003c/span\u003e. The plane reached a maximum speed of 825 mph on its 3,450-mile journey.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWondering how that happened? \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s not magic, but it’s close: a jet stream provided by Ciara. The \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/bdcc7cd1cd0b4c041a13793f65fc431c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewinter storm\u003c/a\u003e blasted Europe with up to 93 mph winds, forcing cancellations of flights and the Manchester City-West Ham Premier League match. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here:\u003c/strong\u003e More transatlantic travel knowledge bombs:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNYC-London isn't the fastest transatlantic flight at all. For example, an Aer Lingus plane flew from Boston to Dublin in 4 hours and 49 minutes the same night.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt's important to note \"subsonic\" when talking about the record. In 1996, the supersonic Concorde plane flew from NYC to London in two hours, 52 minutes, and 59 seconds. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp Habitas 3D-prints the basic structures of its hotel rooms, which limits buildout time to six to nine months and earns Habitas a return on investment within two years—unheard of for traditional hotels, cofounder \u003cspan\u003eOliver Ripley told the FT.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHabitas will use its fresh $20 million to expand to new markets in Asia, the Middle East, and Africa.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Habitas \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/angelinavillaclarke/2018/07/18/how-the-habitas-brand-is-changing-the-way-we-travel/?utm_source=morning_brew#5e76e3fc1525?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esays it’s capitalizing\u003c/a\u003e on the trend du jour for millennials—human connection over fancy lobbies—in a strategy made famous by clubs like Soho House and The Wing.
